args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . U.S. troops arrive at Guantánamo Bay in Trump migrant crackdown Infantry Marines and other U.S. troops have begun arriving at the U.S. naval base at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, U.S. military officials said Monday, in what is expected to be a significant operation to house migrants until the Trump administration sends them to their home countries. The deployments include members of 1st Battalion, 6th Marines, of Camp Lejeune in North Carolina, along with service members from U.S. Southern Command and U.S. Army North — headquarters units that will oversee aspects of the operation. The Defense Department disclosed the deployment Monday, after the White House posted Sunday morning that the Marines had begun arriving. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, who is due to travel to the southern U.S. border Monday, has said the Guantánamo facility will be useful to house migrants whose home country is not immediately assisting with return. They would be detained on a separate part of the base from where militants and terrorism suspects have long been held. The Trump administration has said that up to 30,000 migrants could be held at Guantánamo. Migrants have been held there in the past, but in much smaller numbers.
